intro: Mollia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered mollia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Mollia grandiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
